channel.title: Comments on: Palm Tungsten C revisited
channel.description: I am multiple and various - Tomas A. Krag

item.title: By: Jim Campbell
item.dc:creator: Jim Campbell
item.description:
What are you using for the ssh client? I just ordered the Tungsten C and I'm really looking forward to being able to remote administer my server(s) from any hotspot!
Remove the "dot" from my address for email.
Thanks, Jim
item.content:encoded:
What are you using for the ssh client? I just ordered the Tungsten C and I’m really looking forward to being able to remote administer my server(s) from any hotspot!

Remove the “dot” from my address for email.

Thanks,
Jim

item.title: By: Tomas
item.dc:creator: Tomas
item.description:
There are basically 2 ssh clients I found, Mocha Telnet from Mochasoft (http://www.mochasoft.dk/palm.html), is a 25$ piece of software and is pretty stable and feature-risch, but is NOT made for high-res devices, which means a lot of left-right scrolling in actual use.
TuSSH (short for Tungsten SSH) is a simple, but high-res and FREE ssh client. So far it is ssh 1 only (but the author is working on support for ssh2). It's currently in version 0.55 but progress is really fast, so I have high hopes for it. check it out here: (http://staff.deltatee.com/~angusa/TuSSH.html)
Hope that helps
/Tomas
item.content:encoded:
There are basically 2 ssh clients I found, Mocha Telnet from Mochasoft (http://www.mochasoft.dk/palm.html), is a 25$ piece of software and is pretty stable and feature-risch, but is NOT made for high-res devices, which means a lot of left-right scrolling in actual use.

TuSSH (short for Tungsten SSH) is a simple, but high-res and FREE ssh client. So far it is ssh 1 only (but the author is working on support for ssh2). It’s currently in version 0.55 but progress is really fast, so I have high hopes for it.
check it out here: (http://staff.deltatee.com/~angusa/TuSSH.html)

Hope that helps

/Tomas

item.title: By: beefcommando
item.dc:creator: beefcommando
item.description:
check out pssh, it supports ssh version 2 and seems to work well.
http://www.sealiesoftware.com/pssh/
item.content:encoded:
check out pssh, it supports ssh version 2 and seems to work well.
